Detailed Description

This module contains the EMV layer 4 stack, an exmaple implementation of the EMV terminal main loop, and some examples for EMV terminal applications.

EMV Layer 4

The layer 4 implementation of the EMV stack consists of only two functions.

One function to init the layer 4: emvInitLayer4(). This must be used after successfull activation of a PICC to initialize the ISO14443-4 half duplex protocol stack.

And, one function to communicate with a card on layer 4 (in the context of APDUs): emvTransceiveApdu(). This function deals with all the timeout, error handling, and retransmission requirements of the EMV contactless communication protocol and thus provides a transparent way to transmit an APDU to the RFID card and receive any RPDU send by the card in response.

Example EMV Terminal Application Main Loop

The example terminal application main loop is intended as a blue print which shows how different parts of the EMV software stack should be used together to implement an EMV standard compliant terminal application.

The function emvStartTerminalApplication() will start an EMV terminal main loop as defined in the EMV standard. This main loop pools for cards until a card can be successfully activated and then transfers control to the specified application callback to perform the payment application. After the application callback returns a card removal is executed. Once the RFID card has been removed from the field the terminal main loop starts over again and polls for a new card.

This exapmle terminal main loop continues to run until a call (from another thread) is made to emvStopTerminalApplication(). The emv layer does not check for terminal application stop requests while an RFID data transmission is in progress. Therefore it can take up to 5 seconds until a stop requests leads to the termination of the terminal main loop (about 5 seconds is the maximum allowed timeout for a single block transmission on layer 4).

Example Terminal Application Callbacks

Two example application callbacks for the terminal application main loop are provided. The prevalidation test application emvPrevalidationApplication() and the digital test application emvDigitalApplication(). These two implement the application logic specified in the requirements for the prevaliation test and digital test of the EMV L1 certification.

Implementation Overview of the Terminal Application Main Loop

The polling loop of the terminal application main loop is implemented in emvPoll(). A call to this function blocks until a card is found or a stop of the terminal application main loop is requested.

If the presence of a card is indicated by the return value of emvPoll(), then emvCollisionDetection() is used to perform an EMV compliant collision detection for both type A and type B cards. After successfull collision detection the EmvPicc_t paramter of emvCollisionDetection() references the singulated PICC.

This EmvPicc_t value can then be used to activate (emvActivate()) and initialize (emvInitLayer4()) the layer 4 protocol, perform data transmission (emvTransceiveApdu()), and finally to check for the correct removal of the card form the field (emvRemove()).

Function Documentation

s16 emvActivate ( EmvPicc_t *  picc)
Parameters:
[in]piccThe PICC to activate.
Returns:
EMV_ERR_OK: No error, operation successfull.
EMV_ERR_STOPPED: A stop request was received during activation.
EMV_ERR_TIMEOUT: Timeout during PICC activation.
EMV_ERR_TRANSMISSION: Transmission error during PICC activation.
EMV_ERR_PROTOCOL: Protocol error during PICC activation.
s16 emvDigitalApplication ( )
Returns:
EMV_ERR_OK No error, digital test application stopped by request from the test card.
EMV_ERR_STOPPED: Digital test application stopped by request from the EMV TTA L1 GUI.
other: Digital test application stopped due to an errornous card response. See emv_error_codes.h for details on EMV card response error codes.
s16 emvInitLayer4 ( EmvPicc_t *  picc)

Resets the ISO14443-4 protocoll stack and initializes it for communicaiton with a specific card.

Note:
The PICC must be in the active state for layer-4 data transmissions to work.
Parameters:
[in]piccThe target PICC for ISO14443-4 data transmissions.
Returns:
EMV_ERR_OK: No error, operation successful.
s16 emvPrevalidationApplication ( )
Returns:
EMV_ERR_OK No error, prevalidation test application completed successfully.
EMV_ERR_STOPPED: Prevalidation test application stopped by request from the EMV TTA L1 GUI.
other: Prevalidation test application stopped due to an errornous card response. See emv_error_codes.h for details on EMV card response error codes.
s16 emvRemove ( EmvPicc_t *  picc)
Note:
This function blocks until the PICC is physically removed from the reader field or a stop request is received via emvStopTerminalApplication().
Parameters:
[in]piccThe PICC to remove.
Returns:
EMV_ERR_OK: No error, operation successfull.
EMV_ERR_STOPPED: A stop request was received during activation.
s16 emvStartTerminalApplication ( s16(*)(void)  application)

Start the EMV terminal application. The terminal main loop polls for cards until a single card is detected and successfully activated. Then the application callback is called to perform any higher layer operations. After the callback returns either a field reset or card removal is performed, depending on the error status returned by the application callback. Then the cycle starts again with polling.

Note:
You need to call emvStopTerminalApplication() to stop the terminal application from outside. Otherwise this function call blocks the application callback requests a stop.
Parameters:
[in]applicationHigher layer application call back.
Returns:
EMV_ERR_STOPPED: The terminal application has been stopped due to a stop request.
bool_t emvStopRequestReceived ( )
Returns:
TRUE: A stop terminal request has been received from the GUI.
FALSE: No stop terminal request has been received.
s16 emvTransceiveApdu ( const u8 *  apdu,
size_t  apduLength,
u8 *  response,
size_t  maxResponseLength,
size_t *  responseLength 
)

Send a command APDI and receives the response APDU from the PICC.

Parameters:
[in]apduCommand APDU.
[in]apduLengthLength of the command APDI in bytes.
[out]responseBuffer for the response APDU.
[in]maxResponseLengthSize of the response APDI buffer in bytes.
[out]responseLengthThe length of the received response APDU in bytes.
Returns:
EMV_ERR_OK: No error, response APDU received.
EMV_ERR_PROTOCOL: Protocl error during reception of the response APDU.
EMV_ERR_TRANSMISSION: Transmission error during reception of the response APDU.
EMV_ERR_TIMEOUT: No response APDU receied, or a timeout occured during reception of the response APDU.
EMV_ERR_INTERNAL: Internal buffer overflow during reception of the response APDU.
